content:
19. The jar of meal shall not be spend and the cruse of oil 
shall not fail, until the day that the Lord sends rain 
upon the earth. From the context, which of these 
statements is UNTRUE? 
A. The meal in the jar and the oil in the cruse 
were continually replenished thereafter 
B. The widow of Zerephath prepared food for 
Elijah 
C. The widow and hers son ate the food and 
waited for their death. 
D. The woman was gathering sticks to prepare 
her last meal 
 
20. Which of these Kings did not assassinate his 
predecessor but was assassinated by his successor? 
A. Shallum B. Pekah C. Hoshae D. Pekahiah 
 
21. Hosea said that the children of Israel shall dwell many 
days without king or prince without sacrifice or pillar, 
without … 
A. ephod on teraphim B. prophet or seer 
C. dream or vision    D. Tummim or Urim 
22. To whom does this refer? 
And he burned his son as an offering, and practised 
soothsaying and augury, and dealt with mediums and 
with wizards. He did much evil in the sight of the Lord, 
provoking him to anger. 
A. Hezehiah B. Manasseh C. Josiah D. Jehoiakim 
 
23. Who was that Egyptian king who not only made Eliakim 
king of Judah but changed Eliakim’s name to Jehoiakim? 
A. So B.  Neco C.  Shishak D. Hophra 
 
24. Jeremiah wrote to the exiles in Babylon and encourages 
them to 
A. fight for their return 
B. come back home to rebuild the temple 
C. seek the welfare of Babylon 
D. disobey the king of Babylon 
 
25. Which of these prophets made this prophecy of Zion’s 
happy future at the return of the exiles? “And the 
ransomed the Lord shall return, and come to Zion with 
singing; everlasting joy and shall be upon their heads; 
they shall obtain joy and gladness and sorrow and 
sighing shall flee away. 
A. Jeremiah    B.  Isaiah   C. Zephaniah D. Ezekiel 
 
26. Behold, a virgin shall conceive and bear a son, and his 
name shall be called Emmanuel, which means 
A. Son of Emmaus   B. God with us 
C. Saviour D. God is our 
Redeemer. 
 
27. What specific reply did John the Baptist give to the 
soldiers during his preaching? 
A. ‘Collect no more than is appointed you’ 
B. ‘Do not begin to say to yourselves: we have 
Abraham as our Father 
C. ‘Bear fruits that befit repentance 
D. ‘Be content with your wages. 
28. The order of the locations of Jesus’ temptations 
according to Matthew is 
A. wilderness-high mountain-pinnacle of the 
Temple 
B. wilderness-pinnacle of the temple-high 
mountain 
C. high mountain-wilderness-pinnacle of the 
temple 
D. pinnacle of the temple-wilderness-high 
mountain 
29. When Christ called Levi to follow Him, he 
A. waited two days before he obeyed 
B. accounted for the tax he collected and 
responded  
C. took some of the money he collected before 
following Him 
D. left everything and followed Him 
30. The miracle which touched on ingratitude  is the 
A. healing of Bartimaeus 
B. raising of Jairus’ daughter 
C. cure of the ten lepers 
D. cure of the demoniac 
31. The parable of the unmerciful servant teaches that 
A. we should exercise patience until our debtors pay us 
B. we should forgive our debtors from our hearts 
C. all debts should be reported 
D. debtors should be jailed until they pay all their debts. 
 
32. The ways in which various people hear the word of 
God are described in the parable of the 
A. Sower B.Wheat and the tares 
C. Fig tree  D. Vineyard 
33. But if it is by the spirit of God that I cast out demons, then 
… 
A. God has defeated Satan 
B. the kingdom of Satan cannot stand 
C. the kingdom of God has come upon you 
D. the kingdom of Satan is already divided. 
 
34. ‘I assure you, unless you change and become like little 
children, you will not enter the kingdom of God.’ 
This is a warning by Jesus against 
A. anger   B. ambition C. wealth D. disobedience 
 
35. Jesus taught that fasting in addition to prayers, is 
necessary in some situations, during the healing of the 
A. blind beggar B. dropsied man 
C. gerasene demoniac   D. epileptic boy 
 
36. Jesus did not grant the request of the sons of Zebedee 
because  
A. they were not qualified for the privilege they 
asked for 
B. He did not want to encourage rivalry among the 
disciples 
C. it was not His to grant the request 
D. they could not drink with Jesus’ cup. 
 
37. The parable which teaches persistence in prayer is that 
of the 
A. Unjust judge B. Sower 
C. Good Samaritan   D. Prodigal son 
38. To give the widow’s mite is to give 
A. more that others  B. less than others 
C. everything possible D. two copper coins 
 
39. Which of these women was absent during the crucifixion 
of Jesus Christ? 
A. Mary Magdalene B. Elizabeth 
C. Mary mother of Jesus D. Salome 
 
40. To explain the outpouring of the Holy Spirit on the day 
of Pentecost, Peter quoted Prophet 
A. Isaiah B.  Jeremiah C.  Joel D. Ezekiel
